New Records: Giancarlo Stanton reached 25 homers for the 10th time in his big league career
Key Match Events: Gerrit Cole struck out nine over six innings before his right calf cramped
Gleyber Torres had three hits for the AL-leading Yankees, including a two-run double in the third inning that put them ahead to stay
Anthony Rizzo had a two-run double in their five-run sixth inning after Aaron Judge doubled for his MLB-best 124th RBI
Luke Weaver took over, immediately allowing a single to Josh Jung and a homer to Wyatt Langford
Pre-Game Insights: There are no pre-game insights mentioned in the article
Post-Match Reflections: Gerrit Cole said he wasn't super concerned about the cramp and didn't think it was the right situation to keep trying to manipulate it out there
Giancarlo Stanton said it's pretty cool to reach 25 homers for the 10th time in his career, but what's most important is helping the team win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees (80-58) remained a half-game ahead of Baltimore in the AL East
The 24-year-old Jack Leiter threw 25 sliders and didn't get a single swing and miss, but pitched into the sixth inning for the first time in five big league starts
Leiter's father, Al, played for the Yankees during his first three big league seasons and his last
Leiter's cousin, Mark Leiter Jr., is a Yankees reliever
Others: Rangers: Cy Young Award winners Jacob deGrom and Max Scherzer are both scheduled to make rehab starts Saturday
Yankees RHP Clarke Schmidt (right lat strain) struck out seven without a walk while allowing two runs over 4 2/3 innings in a rehab start for Double-A Somerset
